siteMetadata.title: Catalog of Archived Suborbital Earth Science Investigations
siteMetadata.description: An inventory of NASA’s airborne and field campaigns for Earth Science

heroImage.nasaImgAlt: NASA's DC-8 flying laboratory passes Antarctica's tallest peak, Mount Vinson, on Oct. 22, 2012, during a flight over the continent to measure changes in the massive ice sheet and sea ice. Credit: NASA/Michael Studinger (Photography courtesy NASA Images)

image.nasaImgAlt: A network of farms and ranches surrounds the cities and small towns near the Nebraska–Iowa border. (Photography courtesy NASA/GSFC)
Phytoplankton blooms across the northern basins of the North Atlantic and Arctic Oceans. (Photography courtesy NASA/Climate)

nodes.example: US Gulf coast, Pacific NW, FL Everglades

image.nasaImgAlt: Pristine sand dunes near the launch pads at Kennedy Space Center in Florida. (Photography courtesy NASA Images)
The Cuernos del Paine mountains in Torres del Paine National Park, Chile, during NASA's AirSAR 2004 campaign. (Photography courtesy NASA Images)
The Republic of Maldives with its twenty-six atolls, and 1192 coral islands, with an average ground elevation of 1.5 meters (about 5 feet). (Photography courtesy NASA/Climate)

nodes.example: Sahara, Sonoran regions of SW US

image.nasaImgAlt: The lidar on its tripod. (Photography courtesy NASA/GSFC)
Tropical forests, such as those in Gabon, Africa, are an important reservoir of carbon. (Photography courtesy Sassan Saatchi, NASA/JPL-Caltech.)
The narrow island of Manhattan, located between the Hudson River and the East River. (Photography courtesy NASA/GSFC)
Variegated green crop circles cover what was once shortgrass prairie in southwestern Kansas. (Photography courtesy NASA/GSFC)

nodes.example: Singapore, Indonesia, portions of central Africa

image.nasaImgAlt: Equatorial Wave Line, Pacific Ocean. (Photography courtesy NASA Images)

nodes.example: Caribbean Sea, most of Central America, portions of South America, Indonesia, Philippines

image.nasaImgAlt: An archipelago in the Andaman Sea surrounded by extensive coral reefs (Photography courtesy NASA/GSFC)

nodes.example: most of the contiguous US, Europe and extreme northern Africa

image.nasaImgAlt: A NASA scientific balloon awaits launch in McMurdo, Antarctica. (Photography courtesy NASA/GSFC)
Sea ice hugging the coast of East Greenland. (Photography courtesy NASA/GSFC)
Great Barrier Reef near Whitsunday Islands. (Photography courtesy NASA/GSFC)
A stream in the La Selva region of the Costa Rican rain forest, taken during NASA's AirSAR 2004 campaign. (Photography courtesy NASA Images)
